summary.para: A custom Type Editor for class styles. This editor allows the style class names to be added to a list from which the user can select. This is possible because the property grid is signed with a "reflection" permission that allows for private reflection.

member.name: M:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebNavigator.ClassUIEditor.#ctor
member.summary: Public Constructor with no parameters

summary.para: Creates a list box to show in the property grid.
Private function to fill the contents of our list box.
This is an override from UITypeEditor. The editor style indicates what type of editor we are providing: we can either display a dialog or a drop-down box. Our editor always shows a drop-down box.
Called when the user clicks something in the list box. We close the drop down at this time.
Owner draw list box displays classess in the list box
We override this from Control so we can designate that the return key should be used for input. In other words, we want return to come to us, not be treated as the "OK" to dismiss a dialog.
We handle keyboard processing here for the return key. We treat this key like a click on the list box.

member.name: F:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebNavigator.WebMenuStyle.WinClient
member.summary: Menu will have a Windows Client Application (Windows 2000) appearance. Sub-menus below the top-level menu will only appear when a click is performed on the top-level item. Also, the class property will be given to top level menu items that have been selected and expanded. This allows top level menus to be given one style for hovering, and a different style when selected.

member.name: F:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebNavigator.WebMenuStyle.XPClient
member.summary: Menu will have a Windows Client Application (Windows XP) appearance. The behavior of menus with this style is very similar to those with the WinClient style. In addition, The property and the properties will be used to create a margin on the left of sub-menus where images will be displayed.

member.name: T:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebNavigator.LoadOnDemand
member.summary: Enumeration of the types of Load On Demand styles supported. These property settings control the methods used to load nodes into the tree.

member.name: F:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebNavigator.LoadOnDemand.NotSet
member.summary: All nodes are populated during a databind operation and expand images are only displayed for nodes that have children.

member.name: F:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebNavigator.LoadOnDemand.Manual
member.summary: The application is responsible for populating the nodes of the tree. The application populates an initial set of nodes. For those nodes that may have children added later, the ShowExpand property is set to true in the application. The tree then reners the node with an expand image next to it. If the user clicks the expand image to expand the node, the DemandLoad event is fired on the server and the children of the node can be populated by the application.

member.name: F:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebNavigator.LoadOnDemand.Automatic
member.summary: The application databinds the tree using a dataset. Initially, only the nodes at the top level of the hierarchy are added to the tree. All level 0 nodes with children in the dataset are rendered with the ShowExpand property set to true. When the user clicks a node expandsion indicator, the page is posted back and the databind is performed again. This time, the node that was expanded is also populated from the dataset. No unexpanded nodes are populated. Using the Automatic form of LoadOnDemand requires that DataBind() is called on each postback.

member.name: T:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebNavigator.ExpandEffects
member.summary: This object encapsulates the Internet Explorer Transitions functionality that UltraWebMenu exposes. (Expand Effects are not available in not IE browsers or IE prior to version 5.5).

member.name: M:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebNavigator.ExpandEffects.#ctor
member.summary: Returns a reference to the ExpandEffects object for the Menu control.

remarks.p: The ExpandEffects object encapsulates the settings of the expansion effects that can be applied to sub-menus. Expansion effects are dynamic visual trnasitions applied to the menu when it first appears. You can use this object to specify an effect such as Fade In, Iris, Slide, Gradient Wipe or Pixelate. This object also contains properties for controlling the effects that will be applied during the transition, such as delay and duration, and that will be applied to the menu during and after the transition, such as opacity and drop shadow.

The transition effects applied to the menu rely on the transition features built into Internet Explorer version 5 or greater. These settings are ignored in down-level browsers or any version of Netscape. The visual effects are also operating system dependant, and may not be available on all systems.

member.name: M:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebNavigator.ExpandEffects.ToString
member.summary: Returns a string representation of the ExpandEffects object.

remarks.p: Some objects do not have values that can be converted to a string. In these cases, an empty string is returned. The ExpandEffects object will return an empty string.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebNavigator.ExpandEffects.Duration
member.summary: Specifies the amount of time elapsed in milliseconds between the beginning and the end of a transition effect. (Expand Effects are not available in not IE browsers or IE prior to version 5.5).

remarks.p: This is the amount of time it takes the expand effect to occur. If is set to ExpandEffectsType.Notset, this setting has no effect.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebNavigator.ExpandEffects.Opacity
member.summary: Specifies the amount of transparency applied to the sub-menu after the expand effect is complete. (Expand Effects are not available in not IE browsers or IE prior to version 5.5).

remarks.p: This property specifies the opacity of the sub-menu as a percentage. A setting of 100 is completely opaque, a setting of 0 is completely transparent (invisible). A setting in between these values will produce a partially visisble sub-menu through which the contents of the page may be seen.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebNavigator.ExpandEffects.ShadowColor
member.summary: Specifies the color of the drop shadow that will appear under the sub-menu. (Expand Effects are not available in not IE browsers or IE prior to version 5.5).

remarks.p: Drop shadows provide an illusion of depth to sub-menus as they appear over the web page. You can specify the width of the drop shadow using the property.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebNavigator.ExpandEffects.ShadowWidth
member.summary: Specifies the width of the drop shadow that will appear under the sub-menu. (Expand Effects are not available in not IE browsers or IE prior to version 5.5).

remarks.p: Drop shadows provide an illusion of depth to sub-menus as they appear over the web page. Set this property to 0 to eliminate the drop shadow. You can specify the color of the drop shadow using the property.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebNavigator.ExpandEffects.Delay
member.summary: Specifies the amount of time elapsed before a submenu will open up in response to a mouse click or a mouseover. (Expand Effects are not available in not IE browsers or IE prior to version 5.5).

remarks.p: The default delay is 200 milliseconds. This property specifies the time that will elapse before the expand effect begins.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebNavigator.ExpandEffects.RemovalDelay
member.summary: Specifies the amount of time (in milleseconds) a menu will display before removal when the mouse is not over it. (Expand Effects are not available in not IE browsers or IE prior to version 5.5).

remarks.p: The default delay is 1 second (1000 milleseconds. This property specifies the time that will elapse before the submenu is removed.

member.returns: A String that uniquely identifies the postion of the node within the tree or menu hierarchy.

member.summary: Returns the next node available. If the next sibling is not available it moves to the next higher level and attempts to return the next non-null sibling node until it traverses to the top of the hierarchy and there are no further sibling nodes available.

summary.p: Reads the XML contained in the specified file.

Once the XML is read, invoke the DataBind method to bind the nodes or items.
Invoke the ReadXmlDoc method to read XML data from an XmlDocument object.
Invoke the ReadXmlText method to read XML data from an XmlTextReader object.

param.name: filename

member.name: M:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebNavigator.Item.DataBind(System.Collections.ICollection,System.String)
member.summary: Binds the children of this Item to a data source. Events for the data binding are fired to the specified menu control.

remarks.p: Data binding will bind the property of an item or node's children to a specified data source. Once you bind the item, it will automatically be populated with child items drawn from the data source. By default, the first column in the datasource is used, but you can specify any column in the datasource for binding by using the property of the Level that contains the item.
The Level also supports a property. Use this property to specify a column from the datasource that will be bound to the property for the item or node.

member.param: A reference to the UltraWebMenu that owns the Item
The source to be used for data. This must be in the form of an ICollection.
The name of a table or recordset within the dataSource that will be used for item text.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebNavigator.Item.Separator
member.summary: Determines if the menu item is displayed as a separator. For separators, the text is not displayed but instead, the SeparatoreClass property of UltraWebMenu is used to display an image horizontally. The UltraWebMenu.Separator class specifies and image file name as well as a custom rule that specifies Background-repeat:repeat-x to ensure the the image displays fully across the menu. For WebMenuStyle.XPClient menus, the separator class is used for the text only and does not extend fully to the left side of the menu.

This property will return Nothing if there are no more sibling items to return.

member.name: T:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebNavigator.Node
member.summary: The Node object is the basic unit of data for the UltraWebTree component. It represents a particular leaf or branch in the tree hierarchy. It contains information about what data to display as well as what styles to use and what its position in the hierarchy is. Individual Node objects are grouped together into collections of Nodes where each Nodes collection represents a Data Island. A Data Island is a set of nodes that all have the same parent node. Or, in other words, a Data Island consists of all the children of a particular node. Each Node object contains a reference to a Nodes collection which contains the children of the Node. Each Node also contains a reference to the node that is its parent. Nodes at the top level of the hierarchy return a value of null for their Parent property.

member.name: M:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebNavigator.Node.#ctor
member.summary: Public constructor for a Node that requires no parameters.

member.name: M:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebNavigator.Node.#ctor(System.String,Infragistics.WebUI.Shared.Style)
member.summary: Public constructor for a node that requires two parameters.
member.param: The text of the node.
A reference to a Style object that provides appearance information for the node.

summary.p: Returns a string representation of a Node object.

remarks.p: The string returned is the value of the node's Text property.

summary.p: Collapses a parent Node object, hiding its children.

remarks.p: When a node is collapsed, either by user interaction, or programmatically, the NodeCollapsed event is generated.
Nodes that do not have child nodes are always collapsed.
A node can also be collapsed by setting the Expanded property to False.
Nodes that are collapsed display the image set by the CollapseImage property.

param.name: all
param.p: A Boolean value that determines whether the child nodes of the parent should also be collapsed.

summary.p: Expands a parent Node object, revealing its children.

remarks.p: When a node is expanded, either by user interaction, or programmatically, the NodeExpanded event is generated.
Nodes that do not have child nodes cannot be expanded.
A node can also be expanded by setting the Expanded property to True.
Nodes that are expanded display the image set by the ExpandImage property.

param.name: all
param.p: A Boolean value that determines whether the child nodes of the parent should also be expanded.

summary.p: Toggles the expanded/collapsed state of a parent Node object.

remarks.p: Nodes that do not have child nodes cannot be expanded, they are always collapsed.
When a node is expanded, either by user interaction, or programmatically, the NodeExpanded event is generated. Similarly, when a node is collapsed, the NodeCollapsed event is generated.
A node can also be expanded by invoking the Expand method.
Nodes that are expanded display the image set by the ExpandImage property. Nodes that are collapsed use the CollapseImage property.

param.name: all
param.p: A Boolean value that determines whether the expanded/collapsed state of child nodes of the parent should also be toggled.

member.name: M:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebNavigator.Node.NextSiblingParent
member.summary: Returns the next node available. If the next sibling is not available it moves to the next higher level and attempts to return the next non-null sibling node until it traverses to the top of the hierarchy and there are no further sibling nodes available.

member.name: M:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebNavigator.Node.DataBind(System.Collections.ICollection,System.String)
member.summary: Binds the children of this Node to a data source. Events for the data binding are fired to the specified tree control.

remarks.p: Data binding will bind the property of an item or node's children to a specified data source. Once you bind the item, it will automatically be populated with child items drawn from the data source. By default, the first column in the datasource is used, but you can specify any column in the datasource for binding by using the property of the Level that contains the item.
The Level also supports a property. Use this property to specify a column from the datasource that will be bound to the property for the item or node.

member.param: A reference to the UltraWebTree that owns the Node
The source to be used for data. This must be in the form of an ICollection.
The name of a table or recordset within the dataSource that will be used for node text.

When a node is expanded, either by user interaction, or programmatically, the NodeExpanded event is generated. Similarly, when a node is collapsed, the NodeCollapsed event is generated.
A node can also be expanded by invoking the Expand method.

Nodes that are expanded display the image set by the CollapseImage property to show that they can be collapsed. Nodes that are collapsed use the ExpandImage property to show that they can be expanded.

summary.p: Returns or sets a Boolean value that determines whether a Node object is displayed with an expand image next to it, regardless of whether or not it has children. This property is only effective in conjunction with the use of the LoadOnDemand property of the UltraWebTree object.

remarks.p: Set this property to true if LoadOnDemand is set to Manual and you want to indicate that the node can be expanded even though it doesn't have any child nodes.
When the user then clicks the expandsion indicator, the DemandLoad event will be fired on the server, providing the application with the opportunity to load the node with children.

summary.p: Returns a reference to or sets the Margin object that determines the amount of space for a Node object's margins.

remarks.p: Margins can be set for the entire node or for one or more of its sides.
Use this property to specify the margins to render the node with on the client. It will be rendered as the CSS margin attribute.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebNavigator.Node.HasMargin
member.summary: Returns a bool value indicating if the Margin property has been set or not

summary.p: Returns a reference to or sets the Padding object that determines the amount of space inserted between a Node object and its margin.

remarks.p: Padding can be set for the entire node or for one or more of its sides.
Use this property to specify the padding to render the node with on the client. It will be rendered as the CSS padding attribute.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebNavigator.Node.HasPadding
member.summary: Returns a bool value indicating if the Padding property has been set or not

summary.p: Returns a reference to the next visible Node object of a Node object.

remarks.p: A visible node is a node whose parent node is expanded. Root nodes are always considered visible.
The NextNode property can be used to obtain a reference to the next sibling node of a Node object.
This property will return Nothing if no next visible node exists.

summary.p: Returns a reference to the next sibling Node object of a Node object.

remarks.p: The PrevNode property can be used to obtain a reference to the previous sibling node of a Node object.
The FirstNode property can be used to obtain a reference to the first child node of a Node object.
This property will return Nothing if there are no more sibling nodes to return.

summary.p: Returns a reference to the previous sibling Node object of a Node object.

remarks.p: The NextNode property can be used to obtain a reference to the next sibling node of a Node object.
The FirstNode property can be used to obtain a reference to the first child node of a Node object.
This property will return Nothing if there are no more sibling nodes to return.

summary.p: Returns a reference to the previous visible Node object of a Node object.

remarks.p: A visible node is a node whose parent node is expanded. Root nodes are always considered visible.
The PrevNode property can be used to obtain a reference to the previous sibling node of a Node object.
This property will return Nothing if no previous visible node exists.

summary.p: Returns a reference to the first child Node object of a Node object.

remarks.p: The NextNode and PrevNode properties can be used to obtain a reference to the next and previous sibling nodes, respectively, of a Node object.
This property will return Nothing if no child node exists.

When overriding MenuItemChecked in a derived class, be sure to call the base class' OnMenuItemChecked method so that registered delegates receive the event.

summary.p: Reads the XML contained in the specified file, either in its entirety, or only the item or style data contained in it.

remarks.p: Invoke this method to read the XML contained in a file, specified by the filename parameter.

This method will apply item and/or style data for the control. Root items in the XML will be root items in the control. To load the items as children of another item, invoke this method off of the desired item object.
Once the XML is read, invoke the DataBind method to bind the control to the item data.
Invoke the ReadXmlDoc method to read XML data from an XmlDocument object.
Invoke the ReadXmlText method to read XML data from an XmlTextReader object.
The FileUrl property can be set to load noad and/or style data from an .igproj file.

param.name: filename
param.p: An string of text specifying the filename containing the XML to be read.

param.name: bReadData
param.p: A Boolean value that determines whether the item data contained in the XML should be read. Specify True to read the item data.

param.name: bReadStyles
param.p: A Boolean value that determines whether the style data contained in the XML should be read. Specify True to read the style data.

summary.p: Reads the XML contained in the specified XmlTextReader object, either in its entirety, or only the item or style data contained in it.

remarks.p: Invoke this method to read the XML contained in an XmlTextReader object, specified by the xmlDoc parameter.

This method will apply item and/or style data for the control. Root items in the XML will be root items in the control. To load the items as children of another item, invoke this method off of the desired item object.
Once the XML is read, invoke the DataBind method to bind the control to the item data.
Invoke the ReadXmlFile method to read XML data from a text file.
Invoke the ReadXmlDoc method to read XML data from an XmlDocument object.
The FileUrl property can be set to load noad and/or style data from an .igproj file.

summary.p: Set or gets a value that determines whether Section 508 compliant html will be emitted.

remarks.p: Section 508 compliance provides for support of assistive technologies that make html pages accessible for users that require it.

summary.p: Set or gets a value that determines the maximum level of depth that the WebMenu will databind to. Relationships within the DataSet that are deeper will be ignored.

remarks.p: Use this property to limit the number of relationship levels to be included in the display of the WebMenu.

summary.p: Returns a reference to or sets a Style object that determines how an object is rendered on the client.

remarks.p: Use this property to specify the CSS style attributes used to render the object on the client. It will be rendered as the style attribute.

summary.p: Returns a reference to or sets a Style object that determines how an object is rendered on the client.

remarks.p: Use this property to specify the CSS style attributes used to render the object on the client. It will be rendered as the style attribute.

remarks.p: Use this property to specify the CSS style attributes used to render the object on the client. It will be rendered as the style attribute.

summary.p: Returns or sets a boolean value that determines whether or not Select dropdown controls will be automatically hidden when submenus are being displayed.
When this property is set to true, all select controls in the page document are hidden until the popup menus are dismissed.

remarks.p: In Version 3 of WebNavigator, this property only has effect for IE5 and below, as it is not needed for IE 5 and above. This functionality is necessary due to the problematic way that Internet Explorer implements the Select DropDown control. Netscape 6+ handles this situation properly and the hiding of dropdowns is not necessary in versions 6, 7 and higher.

summary.p: Returns or sets a boolean value that determines whether or not submenus are displayed to the left of parent menus or to the right, (the default).
When this property is set to true, all submenus get displayed on the left unless they would run into the edge of the page.
Returns or sets a boolean value that determines whether or not borders within each menu will be collapsed in order to obtain different 3D effects.
Returns or sets a string value that determines the image used for displaying a column on the left side of the menu. This property is used in
conjunction with the WebMenuStyle.XPClient property setting and the XPSpacerWidth property.
The image forms a column that is used as a background for images displayed within the menu.
Returns or sets a Unit value that determines the width of the spacer column on the left side of the menu. This property is used in
conjunction with the WebMenuStyle.XPClient property setting and the XPSpacerImage property.
The image column is used as a background for images displayed within the menu.
Returns or sets a boolean value that determines whether or not the HTML is rendered in a compact format that is less readable but which optimizes page download time.
When this property is set to true, extra spaces, tabs and line feed characters are not used in the rendered html.
Returns the ExpandEffects object that determines the type of filters and transitions that will be used when displaying sub menus under IE 5 and above.
Returns or sets a boolean value that determines whether or not checkboxes will be displayed for menu items by default.

remarks.p: Use this property to turn on Checkbox functionality for the menu as a whole.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebNavigator.UltraWebMenu.WebMenuStyle

summary.p: Returns or sets a WebMenuStyle enumeration value that determines how menus behave on the client.

member.remarks: The possible values for this enumeration are: WebStandard - submenus are displayed as the mouse is moved over top level items. WinClient - submenus are displayed only after a top level item is clicked. XPClient - same as WinClient style along with the XPSPacerImage property value is displayed along the left side of submenus as a background for images.

summary.p: Returns or sets an Alignment enumeration value that determines how menu items at the top level of a menu are aligned.
Returns or sets a string value that controls what image is displayed for checked checkbox items within the menu.
Returns or sets an integer that determines how much padding is used for items in the top level of the menu.

remarks.p: Use this property to increase or decrease the amount of padding space used between the border and the text of menu items at the top level.

summary.p: Returns or sets an integer that determines how much spacing is used between items in the top level of the menu.

remarks.p: Use this property to increase or decrease the amount of space used between the borders of items at the top level.

summary.p: Returns or sets an integer that determines how much padding is used for items in sub menus of the control.

remarks.p: Use this property to increase or decrease the amount of padding space used between the border and the text of of sub menu items.

summary.p: Returns or sets an integer that determines how much spacing is used between items in sub menus of the control.

remarks.p: Use this property to increase or decrease the amount of space used between the borders of sub menu items.

summary.p: Returns or sets a string value that controls what image is displayed for unchecked checkbox items within the menu.
Returns or sets a string of text that determines the name of the CSS class used to render the disabled state of Item objects that have their Enabled property set to false.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebNavigator.UltraWebMenu.TopSelectedClass

summary.p: Returns or sets a string of text that determines the name of the CSS class used to render items on the top level when they are clicked with the mouse, and the WebMenuStyle property is set to WinClient or XPClient.

member.remarks: The purpose of this style is to provide a selected look to top level menu items when they are clicked with the mouse. The selected look is different from the mouse hover look for WinClient and XPClient menu styles.

summary.p: The MenuClientSideEvents object maintains the names of JavaScript functions that are to be called on the client side in response to various events that can be processed there without the need for a server post-back.
Returns or sets a value that determines which type of menu will be rendered by the control.
Returns a reference to an Items collection that contains the top-level Item objects of the menus.
Returns a reference to a Levels collection that represents each particular hierarchical level of the menus.

remarks.p: Sibling items exist in one level, their children in the next level, and so on.

summary.p: Returns or sets a string of text that determines the type of cursor displayed for the menus when the mouse pointer is over them.

remarks.p: Use this property to specify the cursor to use for the menus on the client. It will be rendered as the CSS cursor attribute.

summary.p: Returns or sets a Boolean value that determines how an item's TargetUrl is linked.

remarks.p: This property determines whether an item's TargetUrl is rendered to the client as an anchor tag or a JavaScript function call.
If this property is set to True, the link is rendered to the client as an HTML a (anchor) tag.
If this property is set to False (Default), the link is rendered to the client as a JavaScript function call as part of the HTML span tag that creates the item.

summary.p: Returns a reference to or sets the Padding object that determines the amount of space inserted between the control and its margin.

remarks.p: Padding can be set for the entire control or for one or more of its sides.
Use this property to specify the padding to render the control with on the client. It will be rendered as the CSS padding attribute.

summary.p: Returns a reference to or sets the Margin object that determines the amount of space for the control's margins.

remarks.p: Margins can be set for the entire control or for one or more of its sides.
Use this property to specify the margins to render the control with on the client. It will be rendered as the CSS margin attribute.

summary.p: Returns or sets a string of text that determines the filename of the image that will be displayed for all Item objects that contain child items.

remarks.p: Use this property to specify the name of the image that isused to indicate that a "sub-menu" exists.
The default value of this property is "ig_menuTri.gif", an image of a small triangle.
If the ImageDirectory property is set, its value is prepended to the value of this property.

summary.p: Returns or sets a string of text that determines the filename of the image that will be displayed when a menu needs to be scrolled upward.

remarks.p: Use this property to specify the name of the image that is used to indicate that a menu may be scrolled upward in order to reveal additional items that would otherwise not be visible, due to the size of the current web page.
The default value of this property is "igmenu_scrollup.gif".
If the ImageDirectory property is set, its value is prepended to the value of this property.

summary.p: Returns or sets a string of text that determines the filename of the image that will be displayed when a menu needs to be scrolled downward.

remarks.p: Use this property to specify the name of the image that is used to indicate that a menu may be scrolled downward in order to reveal additional items that would otherwise not be visible, due to the size of the current web page.
The default value of this property is "igmenu_scrolldown.gif".
If the ImageDirectory property is set, its value is prepended to the value of this property.

summary.p: Returns or sets a string of text that determines the filename of the image that will be displayed when a menu needs to be scrolled upward.

remarks.p: Use this property to specify the name of the image that is used to indicate that a menu may be scrolled upward in order to reveal additional items that would otherwise not be visible, due to the size of the current web page.
The default value of this property is "igmenu_scrollup_disabled.gif".
If the ImageDirectory property is set, its value is prepended to the value of this property.

summary.p: Returns or sets a string of text that determines the filename of the image that will be displayed when a menu can be scrolled, but not in the downward direction.

remarks.p: Use this property to specify the name of the image that is used to indicate that a menu may be scrolled downward, but that it is currently displaying the last item.
The default value of this property is "igmenu_scrolldown_disabled.gif".
If the ImageDirectory property is set, its value is prepended to the value of this property.

summary.p: Returns or sets a string of text that determines the name of the directory where images used by the menus are stored.

remarks.p: The specified directory name is prepended to the filenames for the image properties.
If the images used by the menus span multiple directories, this property should not be set. Instead, the path should be included when setting the image properties.

summary.p: Returns or sets a string of text that determines the URL of an image to be displayed in the background of the menus.

remarks.p: If the ImageDirectory property is set, its value is prepended to the value of this property.

summary.p: Returns or sets a string of text that determines the name of the CSS class used to render the normal state of all Item objects.
Deprecated. The WebMenu.ItemStyle properties should be used instead

remarks.p: The CSS class can be defined in either an inline or external style sheet or in the Styles collection.
If an individual Item object has its CssClass property set, it overrides the value of this property.
The HoverClass property can be used to set the class used to render all Item objects when the mouse pointer is over them.

summary.p: Returns or sets a string of text that determines the URL of an image that will be displayed for all items.

remarks.p: If an individual item has its Image property set, it overrides the value of this property.
If the ImageDirectory property is set, its value is prepended to the value of this property.

summary.p: Returns or sets a string of text that determines the name of the CSS class used to render the menus.

remarks.p: The CSS class can be defined in either an inline or external style sheet or in the Styles collection.

summary.p: Returns or sets a string of text that determines the name of the CSS class used to render all Item objects when the mouse pointer is over them.
Deprecated. The WebMenu.HoverItemStyle properties should be used instead

remarks.p: The CSS class can be defined in either an inline or external style sheet or in the Styles collection.
If an individual Item object has its HoverClass property set, it overrides the value of this property.
The CssClass property can be used to set the class class used to render the normal state of the item.
The HiliteClass property can be used to set the class used to render the item when it is selected.

summary.p: Returns or sets a string of text that determines the name of the CSS class used to render all Separator style items.
Deprecated. The WebMenu.SeparatorStyle properties should be used instead

remarks.p: The CSS class can be defined in either an inline or external style sheet or in the Styles collection.
If an individual Separator item has its CssClass property set, it overrides the value of this property.

summary.p: Returns or sets a string of text that determines the name of the CSS class used to render the normal state of all child Item objects.
Deprecated. The WebMenu.IslandStyle properties should be used instead

remarks.p: An island is a set of items that all have the same parent item, and could also be called a sub-menu.
If an individual child Item object has its CssClass property set, it overrides the value of this property.

summary.p: Returns a reference to the Styles collection that contains definitions for how an object should be rendered to the client.

remarks.p: The styles are implemented as inline CSS styles.
Some properties, such as CssClass and HoverClass, expect the name of a CSS class; others, such as Style, require a Style object stored in the Styles collection in order to be rendered to the client.

summary.p: Returns or sets a string of text that determines the URL of an .igproj file from which to load items, styles, or both.

remarks.p: An .igproj file is an XML file with specific tags and attributes. Use the UltraWebDesigner application to create .igproj files for use with the control.
Invoke the DataBind method after setting this property in order to load the items.
The FileFlags property is used to indicate whether items, styles, or both are loaded from the file.

summary.p: Returns or sets a value that determines whether items, styles, or both are loaded by the .igproj file specified by the FileUrl property.

remarks.p: An .igproj file is an XML file with specific tags and attributes. Use the UltraWebDesigner application to create .igproj files for use with the control.
The FileUrl property is used to indicate the .igprog file used.

summary.p: Returns or sets a string of text that determines the name of the file that contains the external JavaScript for client-side functionality.

remarks.p: Use this property to change the name of the external JavaScript file.

summary.p: A relative path to the Infragistics shared JavaScript file.

remarks.p: The default common JavaScript file is ig_shared.js and is located in a virtual directory called /ig_common/20051/scripts.
Note: The shared JavaScript file is required for the UltraWebMenu to function properly at runtime.

summary.p: Returns or sets a Boolean value that determines whether the control automatically posts back to the server when a client-side event is generated.

remarks.p: If this property is set to True, a round trip to the server is caused every time the control generates a client-side event.

summary.p: Occurs when an Item object has been clicked.

remarks.p: This event is generated when the user clicks an item.
If the TargetUrl property of the item is set, the browser will navigate to the new URL.

summary.p: Occurs when an Item object checkbox has beend checked.

remarks.p: This event is generated when the user clicks an item checkbox.

member.name: M:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebNavigator.UltraWebTree.InitializeDefaultStyles
member.summary: This method creates default style objects that ensure that basic functionality is present within the menu. This functionality includes: a basic default style for menu items, a basic default style for the Hover class, and a basic, default style for the Separator class. This method is called automatically by the Designers but can be called explicitly from code if the menu is being configured dynamicaly.

summary.p: Removes all Node objects in the control.

remarks.p: Invoke the Remove method of the Nodes collection to remove a specific node.
Invoke the Clear method of the Nodes collection to remove all children of a specific node.

summary.p: Clears the Nodes, Styles, and Levels collections in the control.

remarks.p: Invoke this method to effectively "reset" the control to its default state for the Nodes, Styles, and Levels collections.

summary.p: Expands all parent Node objects, revealing their children.

remarks.p: Invoke this method to expand all nodes in the tree that have children.
The ColapseAll method can be invoked to collapse all parent nodes.
The Expanded property of a Node object can be set to True to expand a single node.
When a node is expanded, either by user interaction, or programmatically, the NodeExpanded event is generated.
Nodes that are expanded display the image set by the ExpandImage property.

summary.p: Collapses all parent Node objects, hiding their children.

remarks.p: Invoke this method to collapse all nodes in the tree that have children.
The ExpandAll method can be invoked to expand all parent nodes.
The Expanded property of a Node object can be set to False to collapse a single node.
When a node is collapsed, either by user interaction, or programmatically, the NodeCollapsed event is generated.
Nodes that are collapsed display the image set by the CollapseImage property.

summary.p: Finds the first Node object whose value of the Text property value matches the specified value of the text parameter.

remarks.p: The Find method has several manners in which it can be invoked.
Invoke the FindNext method to find the next Node object that matches the specified criterion.

param.name: text
param.p: The string of text being sought in a Node object's Text property.

param.name: casesensitive
param.p: A Boolean value that determines whether the search is case sensitive. If True, a binary comparison is made. If False, a textual comparison is made.

returns.p: Node object, if a match is found; otherwise, Nothing or Null.

summary.p: Finds the first Node object whose Tag property value matches the specified value of the datatag parameter.

remarks.p: The Find method has several manners in which it can be invoked.
Invoke the FindNext method to find the next Node object that matches the specified criterion.

param.name: datatag
param.p: The object reference being sought in a Node object's Tag property.

returns.p: Node object, if a match is found; otherwise, Nothing or Null.

summary.p: Finds the next Node object whose value of the Text property value matches the specified value of the text parameter. Invoked after the Find method.

param.name: startafternode
param.p: A reference to the Node object to be used as the origin of the search. Only nodes after this node will be sought.

param.name: text
param.p: The string of text being sought in a Node object's Text property.

param.name: casesensitive
param.p: A Boolean value that determines whether the text search is case sensitive. If True, a binary comparison is made. If False, a textual comparison is made.

remarks.p: First, invoke the Find method to find the first Node object that matches the specified criterion. Then invoke this method to find the next match.
The FindNext method has several manners in which it can be invoked.

returns.p: Node object, if a match is found; otherwise, Nothing or Null.

summary.p: Finds the next Node object whose Tag property value matches the specified value of the datatag parameter. Invoked after the Find method.

remarks.p: First, invoke the Find method to find the first Node object that matches the specified criterion. Then invoke this method to find the next match.
The FindNext method has several manners in which it can be invoked.

param.name: datatag
param.p: The object reference being sought in a Node object's Tag property.

param.name: startafternode
param.p: A reference to the Node object to be used as the origin of the search. Only nodes after this node will be sought.

returns.p: Node object, if a match is found; otherwise, Nothing or Null.

summary.p: Returns an enumerator object that can be used to travers through all nodes of the tree.

remarks.p: The returned ArrayList will contain the list of Node objects that have their Checked property set to true, either by the user, or through code, regardless of the CheckBox property setting of the Node or the CheckBoxes property of the Level or Tree objects.

summary.p: Finds the first Node object whose value of the Text property value matches the specified value of the text parameter.

remarks.p: The Find method has several manners in which it can be invoked.
Invoke the FindNext method to find the next Node object that matches the specified criterion.

param.name: text

param.p: A Boolean value that determines whether the search is case sensitive. If True, a binary comparison is made. If False, a textual comparison is made.

returns.p: Node object, if a match is found; otherwise, Nothing or Null.

summary.p: Reads the XML contained in the specified file, either in its entirety, or only the node or style data contained in it.

remarks.p: Invoke this method to read the XML contained in a file, specified by the filename parameter.

This method will apply node and/or style data for the control. Root nodes in the XML will be root nodes in the control. To load the nodes as children of another node, invoke this method off of the desired Node object.
Once the XML is read, invoke the DataBind method to bind the control to the node data.
Invoke the ReadXmlDoc method to read XML data from an XmlDocument object.
Invoke the ReadXmlText method to read XML data from an XmlTextReader object.
The FileUrl property can be set to load noad and/or style data from an .igproj file.

param.name: filename
param.p: An string of text specifying the filename containing the XML to be read.

param.name: bReadData
param.p: A Boolean value that determines whether the node data contained in the XML should be read. Specify True to read the node data.

param.name: bReadStyles
param.p: A Boolean value that determines whether the style data contained in the XML should be read. Specify True to read the style data.

summary.p: Reads the XML contained in the specified String object, either in its entirety, or only the node or style data contained in it.
Reads the XML contained in the specified XmlTextReader object, either in its entirety, or only the node or style data contained in it.

remarks.p: Invoke this method to read the XML contained in an XmlTextReader object, specified by the xmlDoc parameter.

This method will apply node and/or style data for the control. Root nodes in the XML will be root nodes in the control. To load the nodes as children of another node, invoke this method off of the desired Node object.
Once the XML is read, invoke the DataBind method to bind the control to the node data.
Invoke the ReadXmlFile method to read XML data from a text file.
Invoke the ReadXmlDoc method to read XML data from an XmlDocument object.
The FileUrl property can be set to load noad and/or style data from an .igproj file.

param.name: xmlReader
param.p: An XmlTextReader object containing the data to be read.

param.name: bReadData
param.p: A Boolean value that determines whether the node data contained in the XML should be read. Specify True to read the node data.

param.name: bReadStyles
param.p: A Boolean value that determines whether the style data contained in the XML should be read. Specify True to read the style data.

summary.p: Reads and loads the tree from the XML contained in the specified XmlDocument, either in its entirety, or only the node or style data contained in it.

remarks.p: Invoke this method to read the XML contained in an XmlDocument object, specified by the xmlDoc parameter.

This method will apply node and/or style data for the control. Root nodes in the XML will be root nodes in the control. To load the nodes as children of another node, invoke this method off of the desired Node object.
Once the XML is read, invoke the DataBind method to bind the control to the node data.
Invoke the ReadXmlFile method to read XML data from a text file.
Invoke the ReadXmlText method to read XML data from an XmlDocument object.
The FileUrl property can be set to load noad and/or style data from an .igproj file.

param.name: xmlDoc
param.p: An XmlDocument object containing the data to be read.

param.name: bReadData
param.p: A Boolean value that determines whether the node data contained in the XML should be read. Specify True to read the node data.

param.name: bReadStyles
param.p: A Boolean value that determines whether the style data contained in the XML should be read. Specify True to read the style data.

member.param: A source xml file containing a hierarchical tree structure suitable for transformation into the xml format that UltraWebTree uses.
An xsl file containing the transformation rules needed to convert the xml file into the format used by UltraWebTree.

summary.p: Writes the XML contained in the tree to a string and returns a reference to the string. The string returned can be later be used in a call to ReadXmlString to restore the state of the tree.

summary.p: Raises the DemandLoad event.

remarks.p: Invoke this method to programmatically generate the DemandLoad event.
Raising an event invokes the event handler through a delegate.
This method also allows derived classes to handle the event without attaching a delegate. This is the preferred technique for handling the event in a derived class.
When overriding DemandLoad in a derived class, be sure to call the base class' OnDemandLoad method so that registered delegates receive the event.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebNavigator.UltraWebTree.ScrollTopPos
member.summary: Sets or gets the ScrollTop position of the tree on the client. This property indicates how far down the control is currently scrolled.

summary.p: Set or gets a value that determines whether Section 508 compliant html will be emitted.

remarks.p: Section 508 compliance provides for support of assistive technologies that make html pages accessible for users that require it.

summary.p: Set or gets a value that determines whether nodes can be dragged within the tree on the page or dragged to other elements on the page.

remarks.p: Use this property to turn on or off the ability to drag nodes within the tree.

summary.p: Set or gets a value that determines whether nodes or other drag operations can be dropped within the WebTree.

remarks.p: Use this property to turn on or off the ability to drop items onto nodes of the tree. The implementation of the drop is application dependent.

summary.p: Set or gets a default value used as a target url for nodes that do not have an individual TargetUrl set.

remarks.p: Use this property to set the default target url for all nodes of the tree. TargetUrl settings for individual nodes will override this default value setting.

summary.p: Set or gets a default value used as a target frame for nodes that do not have an individual TargetFrame value set.

remarks.p: Use this property to set the default target frame for all nodes of the tree. TargetFrame settings for individual nodes will override this default value setting.

summary.p: Set or gets a value that determines the maximum level of depth that the WebTree will databind to. Relationships within the DataSet that are deeper will be ignored.

remarks.p: Use this property to limit the number of relationship levels to be included in the display of the WebTree.

summary.p: Set or gets a value that determines the number of levels within the tree that will be initially expanded.

remarks.p: Use this property to expand nodes at the top few levels of the tree by default.

summary.p: Set or gets an image url that is displayed for all nodes within the tree that do not have children.

remarks.p: Use this property to set an image for nodes without children.

summary.p: Set or gets an image url that is displayed for all nodes within the tree that have children.

remarks.p: Use this property to set an image for nodes with children.

summary.p: Set or gets an image url that is displayed for all nodes within the tree at the root level.

remarks.p: Use this property to set an image for nodes at the root level of the tree. The RootNodeImageUrl property takes precedance over the LeafNodeImageUrl and the ParentNodeImageUrl for nodes at the root level.

summary.p: Returns a reference to or sets a Style object that determines how a node in edit mode is rendered on the client.

remarks.p: Use this property to specify the CSS style attributes used to render the object on the client. It will be rendered as the style attribute.

summary.p: Returns a reference to or sets a Style object that determines how a disabled node is rendered on the client.

remarks.p: Use this property to specify the CSS style attributes used to render the object on the client. It will be rendered as the style attribute.

remarks.p: Use this property to specify the CSS style attributes used to render the object on the client. It will be rendered as the style attribute.

remarks.p: Use this property to specify the CSS style attributes used to render the object on the client. It will be rendered as the style attribute.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebNavigator.UltraWebTree.CompactRendering

summary.p: Returns or sets a boolean value that determines whether or not the HTML is rendered in a compact format that is less readable but which optimizes page download time.

member.remarks: When set to true, code is rendered without extra spaces, tabs or line breaks.

summary.p: Returns or sets a boolean value that determines whether or not nodes can be expanded one branch at a time.

remarks.p: Use this property to turn on SingleBranchExpand functionality for the tree.

When this property is set to true, only a single branch of the tree hierarchy will be open at a time. All other expanded nodes will be collapsed except for those in the parent hierarchy of the node last expanded.

summary.p: Returns or sets a boolean value that determines whether or not checkboxes will be displayed for nodes.

remarks.p: Use this property to turn on Checkbox functionality for the tree as a whole.
Use the LevelCheckBoxes property to turn checkboxes on or off at various levels of the tree.

summary.p: Returns or sets a string of text that determines the name of the CSS class used to render Node objects that have their Enabled property set to false.

The TreeClientSideEvents object maintains the names of JavaScript functions that are to be called on the client side in response to various events that can be processed without the need for a server post-back.
Returns or sets a value that determines which type of tree will be rendered by the control.
Returns a reference to a Nodes collection that contains the root Node objects of the tree.
Returns a reference to the Styles collection that contains definitions for how an object should be rendered to the client.

remarks.p: The styles are implemented as inline CSS styles.
Some properties, such as CssClass and HoverClass, expect the name of a CSS class; others, such as Style, require a Style object stored in the Styles collection in order to be rendered to the client.

summary.p: Returns a reference to a Levels collection that represents each particular hierarchical level of the tree.

remarks.p: Sibling nodes exist in one level, their children in the next level, and so on.

summary.p: Returns or sets a string of text that determines the type of cursor displayed for the tree when the mouse pointer is over it.

remarks.p: Use this property to specify the cursor to use for the tree on the client. It will be rendered as the CSS cursor attribute.

summary.p: Returns a reference to or sets the Margin object that determines the default amount of space for the margins of all nodes.

remarks.p: Margins can be set for the entire object or for one or more of its sides.
Use this property to specify the default margins to render the object with on the client. It will be rendered as the CSS margin attribute.
If an individual node has its Margin property set, it overrides the value of this property.

summary.p: Returns a reference to or sets the Padding object that determines the default amount of space inserted between an object and its margin.

remarks.p: Padding can be set for the entire object or for one or more of its sides.
Use this property to specify the padding to render the object with on the client. It will be rendered as the CSS padding attribute.
If an individual node has its Padding property set, it overrides the value of this property.

summary.p: Returns a reference to or sets the Margin object that determines the amount of space for the control's margins.

remarks.p: Margins can be set for the entire control or for one or more of its sides.
Use this property to specify the margins to render the control with on the client. It will be rendered as the CSS margin attribute.

summary.p: Returns a reference to or sets the Padding object that determines the amount of space inserted between the control and its margin.

remarks.p: Padding can be set for the entire control or for one or more of its sides.
Use this property to specify the padding to render the control with on the client. It will be rendered as the CSS padding attribute.

summary.p: Returns or sets a Boolean value that determines whether all Node objects with children can be expanded.

remarks.p: If this property is set to True (default), nodes will have their expand/collapse images displayed and can be expanded.
If this property is set to False, nodes will not have their expand/collapse images displayed and cannot be expanded.

summary.p: Returns or sets a Boolean value that determines whether the user can modify the captions of Node objects.

remarks.p: If this property is set to True, the user can modify the caption of a node by double-clicking it. Additionally, the Selectable property is automatically set to True.
If this property is set to False (default), the user cannot modify the caption of a node.
A node's caption can be modified programmatically by setting its Text property.

summary.p: Returns or sets a Boolean value that determines whether Node objects can be selected, either by the user or programmatically.

remarks.p: If this property is set to True (default), nodes can be selected both by the user and programmatically.
If this property is set to False, nodes cannot be selected.
If the Editable property is set to True, then this property is automatically set to True.

summary.p: Contains granular settings for specific events which determine whether the event will fire immediately, (true), or passively during the next normal postback, (false).
Returns or sets a Boolean value that determines whether the control automatically posts back to the server when a client-side event is generated.

remarks.p: If this property is set to True, a round trip to the server is caused every time the control generates a client-side event.

summary.p: Returns or sets a Boolean value that determines how a node's TargetUrl is linked.

remarks.p: This property determines whether a node's TargetUrl is rendered to the client as an anchor tag or a JavaScript function call.
If this property is set to True, the link is rendered to the client as an HTML a (anchor) tag.
If this property is set to False (Default), the link is rendered to the client as a JavaScript function call as part of the HTML span tag that creates the node.
Note:If the WebTree control is Disabled, TargetUrls will still be functional if RenderAnchors is set to true. To disable TargetUrls as well as normal tree behavior, set RenderAnchors to false.

summary.p: Returns a reference to or sets the currently selected Node object.

remarks.p: The selected node is rendered using the SeletectedNodeStyle property.
When a node is selected, either by user interaction, or programmatically, the NodeClicked event is generated.
If no node is selected, this property returns Nothing or Null.

summary.p: Returns or sets the filename of the image displayed for a collapsed node. When clicked, the node will expand.

remarks.p: The CollapseImage property can be used to specify the filename of the image to be displayed for an expanded node.
If the ImageDirectory property is set, its value is prepended to the value of this property.
If the Expandable property is set to False, this property is ignored.

summary.p: Returns or sets the filename of the image displayed for an expanded node. When clicked, the node will collapse.

remarks.p: The ExpandImage property can be used to specify the filename of the image to be displayed for a collapsed node.
If the ImageDirectory property is set, its value is prepended to the value of this property.
If the Expandable property is set to False, this property is ignored.

summary.p: Returns or sets a string of text that determines the name of the directory where images used by the tree are stored.

remarks.p: The specified directory name is prepended to the filenames for the image properties (e.g., CollapseImage, ExpandImage, etc.).
If the images used by the tree span multiple directories, this property should not be set. Instead, the path should be included when setting the image properties.

summary.p: Returns or sets a string of text that determines the URL of an image to be displayed in the background of the tree.

remarks.p: If the ImageDirectory property is set, its value is prepended to the value of this property.

summary.p: Returns or sets a string of text that determines the name of the CSS class used to render the normal state of all Node objects.
Deprecated. The WebTree.NodeStyle properties should be used instead

remarks.p: The CSS class can be defined in either an inline or external style sheet or in the Styles collection.
If an individual Node object has its CssClass property set, it overrides the value of this property.

summary.p: Returns or sets a string of text that determines the name of the CSS class used to render the edit box when a node is in edit mode.
Deprecated. The WebTree.NodeEditStyle properties should be used instead

remarks.p: The CSS class can be defined in either an inline or external style sheet or in the Styles collection.

summary.p: Returns or sets a string of text that determines the URL of an image that will be displayed for all nodes.

remarks.p: If an individual node has its ImageUrl property set, it overrides the value of this property.
If the ImageDirectory property is set, its value is prepended to the value of this property.

summary.p: Returns or sets a string of text that determines the URL of an image that will be displayed for nodes when they are selected.

remarks.p: If an individual node has its SelectedImageUrl property set, it overrides the value of this property.
Setting this value assumes that a DefaultImage property value is also set. If no default image is desired, the DefaultImage property should be set to a blank or transparent image
If the ImageDirectory property is set, its value is prepended to the value of this property.

summary.p: Returns or sets a string of text that determines the name of the CSS class used to render the tree.

remarks.p: The CSS class can be defined in either an inline or external style sheet or in the Styles collection.

summary.p: Returns or sets a string of text that determines the name of the CSS class used to render all Node objects in the tree when they are selected.
Deprecated. The WebTree.SelectedNodeStyle properties should be used instead

remarks.p: The CSS class can be defined in either an inline or external style sheet or in the Styles collection.
If an individual Node object has its HiliteClass property set, it overrides the value of this property.
The CssClass property can be used to set the class used to render the normal state of all nodes.
The HoverClass property can be used to set the class used to render all nodes when the mouse pointer is over them.

summary.p: Returns or sets a string of text that determines the name of the CSS class used to render all Node objects when the mouse pointer is over them.
Deprecated. The WebTree.HoverNodeStyle properties should be used instead

remarks.p: The CSS class can be defined in either an inline or external style sheet or in the Styles collection.
If an individual Node object has its HoverClass property set, it overrides the value of this property.
The CssClass property can be used to set the class class used to render the normal state of the node.
The HiliteClass property can be used to set the class used to render the node when it is selected.

summary.p: Returns or sets a string of text that determines the name of the CSS class used to render the normal state of all child Node objects.
Deprecated. The WebTree.IslandStyle properties should be used instead

remarks.p: An island is a set of nodes that all have the same parent node.
If an individual child Node object has its CssClass property set, it overrides the value of this property.

summary.p: Returns or sets a string of text that determines the URL of an .igproj file from which to load nodes, styles, or both.

remarks.p: An .igproj file is an XML file with specific tags and attributes. Use the UltraWebDesigner application to create .igproj files for use with the control.
Invoke the DataBind method after setting this property in order to load the nodes.
The FileFlags property is used to indicate whether nodes, styles, or both are loaded from the file.

summary.p: Returns or sets a boolean value that specifies whether or not to send Node.DataKey values down to the client so that they are available from the client-side object model using Node.getDataKey().
Returns or sets a value that determines whether nodes, styles, or both are loaded by the .igproj file specified by the FileUrl property.

remarks.p: An .igproj file is an XML file with specific tags and attributes. Use the UltraWebDesigner application to create .igproj files for use with the control.
The FileUrl property is used to indicate the .igprog file used.

summary.p: Returns or sets a string of text that determines the name of the file that contains the external JavaScript for client-side functionality.

remarks.p: Use this property to change the name of the external JavaScript file.

summary.p: A relative path to the Infragistics shared JavaScript file.

remarks.p: The default common JavaScript file is ig_shared.js and is located in a virtual directory called /ig_common/20051/scripts.
Note: The common JavaScript file is required for the UltraWebTree to function properly at runtime.

summary.p: Returns or sets a value that determines how the control is rendered to the client.

remarks.p: Auto (default) The control determines the best way to render itself, based on the browser's capabilities.
DownLevel The control is rendered using HTML 3.2.
UpLevel The control is rendered using HTML 4.0 and DHTML.

summary.p: Returns or sets a value that determines how many pixels child nodes are indented from their parent.

remarks.p: The level of indentation will be rendered as the CSS margin-left attribute.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebNavigator.UltraWebTree.DataMember
member.summary: DataMember is used as the starting table in the DataSet hierarchy for binding.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.UltraWebNavigator.UltraWebTree.DataSource
member.summary: DataSource

summary.p: Occurs when a Node expand button has been clicked and its children need to be populated.

remarks.p: This event is generated when a node expansion indicator is clicked by the user on the client.
This event will only be fired if the LoadOnDemand property of the WebTree is set to LoadOnDemand.Manual.

If a node is expanded programmatically by setting the Expanded property to true, then it must be populated programatically at the same time as well. In this case, the LoadOnDemand event will not be fired.

summary.p: Occurs when a Node object has been selected.

remarks.p: This event is generated when a node is selected, either by user interaction, or programmatically.
A node can be selected programmatically by setting the SelectedNode property.
If the TargetUrl property of the node is set, the browser will navigate to the new URL.

summary.p: Occurs when a Node object has been expanded.

remarks.p: This event is generated when a node is expanded, either by user interaction, or programmatically.
A node can be expanded programmatically by setting its Expanded property to True.
Nodes that do not have child nodes cannot be expanded, they are always collapsed.
Nodes that are expanded display the image set by the ExpandImage property.

summary.p: Occurs when a Node object has been collapsed.

remarks.p: This event is generated when a node is collapsed, either by user interaction, or programmatically.
A node can be collapsed programmatically by setting its Expanded property to False.
Nodes that are collapsed display the image set by the CollapseImage property.

summary.p: Occurs when a Node object is edited.

remarks.p: This event is generated when the user changes a node's text.
